meanings.definition: To regain possession or control of something.
meanings.sent1: After losing his favorite toy, Tim was able to reattain it from under the bed.
meanings.sent2: She was determined to reattain her fitness level after a long break from exercise.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to reattain the ball of yarn, but it kept rolling away.
meanings.sent4: With hard work and dedication, he managed to reattain his former glory.
meanings.sent5: The student studied hard to reattain the top spot in the class.

meanings.sent1: After falling behind, the runner pushed himself to reattain the lead.
meanings.sent2: The team set a goal to reattain their previous level of success.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to reattain the perfect balance of flavors in the dish.
meanings.sent4: She strived to reattain the level of happiness she once had.
meanings.sent5: The artist worked tirelessly to reattain the beauty of his earlier paintings.

meanings.definition: To keep or maintain possession of something.
meanings.sent1: It is important to reattain control of your emotions in stressful situations.
meanings.sent2: The key to success is to reattain focus on your goals.
meanings.sent3: The magician had to reattain the rabbit in his hat after it escaped.
meanings.sent4: She needed to reattain ownership of the valuable antique she had misplaced.
meanings.sent5: The athlete had to reattain his grip on the bat to hit the ball accurately.
